meanings.definition: A bland or insipid intellectual fare, entertainment, etc.
meanings.sent1: The lecture was like pablums, lacking any real substance.
meanings.sent2: She found the book to be a pablums, not engaging her mind at all.
meanings.sent3: The movie was so pablums that it put everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a pablums, offering no new ideas or insights.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit was a pablums, failing to stimulate any interest.

meanings.definition: A bland or insipid intellectual fare, entertainment, etc.
meanings.sent1: The discussion turned into a pablums, with no real debate or excitement.
meanings.sent2: The party was a pablums, with dull music and no activities.
meanings.sent3: The play was so pablums that even the actors seemed bored.
meanings.sent4: The art show was a pablums, lacking any creativity or inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The conference was a pablums, with repetitive topics and no new perspectives.
